Source: World Development Indicators, World Bank.](presentation_files/figure-pdf/fig-gdp-life-output-1.pdf){#fig-gdp-life} ::: ::: ## Top 10 Countries by Education Expenditure ::: {.cell execution_count=3} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![Top 10 Countries by Education Expenditure as a Percentage of GDP (2022). Source: World Development Indicators, World Bank.](presentation_files/figure-pdf/fig-edu-top10-output-1.pdf){#fig-edu-top10} ::: ::: ::: {data-transition="zoom"} ## Visualization observations - Countries with higher GDP per capita generally exhibit longer life expectancy, highlighting how income levels link to healthcare and living standards. - Small island nations like *Kiribati*, *Tuvalu*, and *Vanuatu* allocate over 10% of GDP to education — far above the global average of around 4%. ::: ## Summary Statistics ::: {#tbl-summary-stats .cell tbl-cap='Summary Statistics for Key Development Indicators (2022).' execution_count=4} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=12} ```{=html}
